image.altText: A woman with black a ponytail wipes her eyes with a tissue as she looks down at a photo album crying.

props.synopsis: Speaking to Stateline, the mother of five-year-old Rozalia Spadafora, who died at Canberra Hospital the day after her birthday in 2022, says the coronial inquest into her death had too narrow a focus.

title.children: Focus of inquest into 5yo's death too narrow, mother says

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 50-year-old Canberra man who fled to Spain and hid out for three years to avoid charges including rape and incest allegedly committed against his stepdaughter has his request to be sent to a mental health facility denied.

title.children: Canberra man to face incest and rape charges after extradition from Spain

image.altText: two women sitting at a table looking through documents

props.synopsis: It's been a long and exhausting journey, and even a legally-binding order made by a civil tribunal may not have brought their fight to an end.

title.children: 'We just want to have long service leave': Workers' long fight for entitlements

image.altText: A young man with short dark hair and glasses stands on the steps of a blood donation centre smiling.

props.synopsis: With regular donors away or out of routine, the Red Cross Lifeblood Service often experiences blood shortages over the holidays, but this year demand in Canberra is at a 12-year high.

title.children: Plasma helped Dhruvan recover from a rare disorder. He's calling for more donors

image.altText: Caravan on road

props.synopsis: The tragic death of a man struck by a loose object from a passing caravan has prompted a renewed warning about safety on the roads.

title.children: Friend of man killed in freak caravan incident near Yass calls for specialised driver training

image.altText: A man faces the camera in a mughsot, with long dark braids and wearing a blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Police were searching for Thor Kristiansen for a week after receiving multiple reports including property damage and driving offences.

title.children: Thor Kristiansen arrested after manhunt through Canberra's streets

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The man was found guilty last year of unauthorised camping on unleased national land after sleeping in his car in the National Rock Garden carpark near Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Judge finds homeless man who slept in his car on national land was parking there not camping

image.altText: Members of the public at a crowded beach during sunset.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Canberra set for warm and sunny Christmas Day, with heatwave to come later

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, at a press conference, holding his hand up to his head like a telephone.

props.synopsis: The Russian president says "the other side" of negotiations will need to compromise to bring an end to the Ukraine war.

title.children: Putin says he's ready to 'negotiate and compromise' with Trump on Ukraine

image.altText: A woman with short auburn hair looks at the ground while walking through a door

props.synopsis: Female artists from WA's Pilbara gifted Ms Pelicot the scarf, which she wore prominently throughout the trial of her husband Dominique and dozens of other men for repeatedly drugging and raping her.

title.children: Pilbara scarf presented to Gisèle Pelicot as gesture of solidarity

image.altText: John in a library

props.synopsis: The bestselling author wrote dozens of books and sold millions of copies, but his most lasting legacy may be at a pair of schools nestled in the foothills outside Melbourne.

title.children: John Marsden may be gone, but his education legacy lives on in Victoria

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair speaks from a lectern.

props.synopsis: Minutes after officially recommending a "greenfield" coal mine be approved in Queensland, and approving extensions to three others, Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek boldly declared no new coal mines have been approved in 2024.

title.children: Government allows extension of coal mines as minister boasts of no new approvals

image.altText: Australian travellers boarding a large aircraft.

props.synopsis: Hundreds more Australians stranded in Vanuatu after devastating earthquakes have been flown back home on RAAF flights this evening, with the first plane touching down at 6pm.

title.children: More Australians stranded in earthquake-stricken Vanuatu fly home with RAAF

image.altText: A group of men sitting on colourful plastic chairs

props.synopsis: A group of 15 men from Bangladesh found at a beach on Indonesian's southernmost Rote island say they were held on an Australian Border Force ship for a fortnight before being turned back.

title.children: Bangladeshis found on Indonesian island claim ABF held them for 14 days

image.altText: Older man in a white shirt and navy suit jacket.

props.synopsis: ASIO has denied claims by Australia's most senior private security specialist that he was in part the subject of raids because of his work in the media.

title.children: ASIO hits back at raided former intelligence officer's claims

props.synopsis: A small farming town in regional WA is bucking the trend of shrinking populations. Tambellup has seen an 8 per cent increase in the past 12 months as cheap house prices lure more people to the arid countryside.

title.children: Cheap inland houses are prompting a 'dry barren landscape change'

image.altText: A white wall mounted TP-Link Wireless N Router.

props.synopsis: TP-Link claims to be the world's largest provider of consumer wi-fi networking devices, which are widely used across the United States, Australia and elsewhere.

title.children: Wi-fi routers found in Australian homes could be banned in US over China cyber threat

image.altText: A baby on white sheets wearing pink

props.synopsis: South Australia's deputy coroner has described police evidence at an inquest into the death of a baby killed by her father at a reservoir as "capable of being read as victim-blaming", but the lawyer representing police has rejected that claim, saying the force understood the girl's mother "was under a level of coercive control".

title.children: Police evidence described as 'victim-blaming' at inquest into killing of baby by father at SA reservoir

image.altText: A group of men gather around a smoking power station with palm trees in the background.

props.synopsis: A series of intense Israeli air strikes shook Yemen's rebel-held capital and the port city of Hodeida early on Thursday, shortly after a Houthi missile targeted central Israel.

title.children: Israeli strikes kill nine in Yemen after Houthis target Tel Aviv

image.altText: Macron in Mayotte

props.synopsis: Scientists at the Imperial College London say climate change likely intensified Tropical Cyclone Chido from a category three to a category four storm.

title.children: Macron visits cyclone-wrecked Mayotte as death toll expected to rise

image.altText: sea cucumbers, a brown worm-like marine animal, in a red tub

props.synopsis: The Australian Border Force seized a record 3.2 tonnes of sea cucumber from a single vessel on Wednesday. It marks the second large seizure of sea cucumber in NT waters in recent days.

title.children: Over 3 tonnes of sea cucumber seized in NT illegal fishing operation

image.altText: Pokies

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government shelved its nation-leading pokies reforms due to "significant cost increases and implementation delays". A redacted report used to justify that decision omits what those costs are.

title.children: Report used to justify dropping nation-leading pokies reforms redacts key figure

image.altText: a red Tesla Model 3 sedan is charged at a Tesla dealership with the Tesla logo shown on the dealership building in the back

props.synopsis: Essential workers like police and nurses, and those  earning less than $100,000 a year will be able to purchase electric vehicles using low-interest loans that the federal government says will save them thousands of dollars in interest.

title.children: Low-interest electric vehicle loans for workers earning less than $100k

image.altText: Rainbow flag flying outside Australian Parliament House.

props.synopsis: LGBTI+ advocates say the data can help inform government decisions about Australia's sex- and gender-diverse community.

title.children: ABS releases first-ever estimates of LGBTI+ Australians

image.altText: people on platform with trains

props.synopsis: Sydney commuters are warned of major train delays and cancellations in the lead up to Christmas, after the Rail, Tram and Bus Union had a win in the Federal Court.

title.children: Travel chaos looms for Sydney train commuters after union court win

image.altText: South Sea Islanders work on the sugarcane plantations

props.synopsis: The whereabouts of South Sea Islanders believed to have been buried on a hospital site in North Queensland in the late 1800s remains a mystery after a ground-penetrating radar search failed.

title.children: Search for up to 1,000 South Sea Islanders at hospital site fails to find burials

image.altText: Two damaged buses are removed by a crane.

props.synopsis: The accidents happened in Ghazni province on the same highway between the capital Kabul and the southern city of Kandahar.

title.children: Fifty-two killed, dozens injured in Afghanistan bus accidents

image.altText: A man in green military attire sits in a blue chair speaking in to a small microphone during an address

props.synopsis: Ukrainian sources were quick to background journalists to say they were behind the killing of Russian General Igor Kirillov. Experts say it's likely not that simple.

title.children: Did Russian resistance kill one of the country's top generals?

image.altText: Lisa Lines smiles as she sits behind a desk with her hands clasped together

props.synopsis: An Adelaide magistrate has ruled that a woman charged with plotting to murder her ex-partner will have to prove her innocence in court, despite her arguing there isn't enough evidence to convict her of the crime.

title.children: Woman loses bid to have attempted axe murder charge thrown out of court

image.altText: Two brown ducks in an enclosure

props.synopsis: Staff at a high school in Southern New South Wales arrive at work to find its rare and treasured resident ducks slaughtered by intruders.

title.children: Beloved school ducks killed and mutilated in 'horrific act of cruelty'

image.altText: On an orange background two book covers sit at angles: Dear Miffy and Tomorrow When the War Began

props.synopsis: Choosing a favourite John Marsden book is a tough gig; he produced so many powerful works in his more-than-35-year writing career. Looking back at his more than 40 works, ABC Arts reviewers share the Marsden book that moved them the most.

title.children: We look back on the best books of the late, great John Marsden

image.altText: A close up of hand holding a fuel pump at the bowser

props.synopsis: Fuel prices are set to rise in multiple major cities over the festive season, according to the peak body for motoring and travel.

title.children: Fuel prices to increase in most cities ahead of Christmas, peak motoring body says

image.altText: A man with sun-bleached hair hold a new surfboard upright while another man embraces him, grinning.

props.synopsis: Sam Taylor was trying to reach a swimmer struggling in a rip when he found himself in similar trouble on a New South Wales beach, but a nearby 14-year-old came to his aid.

title.children: Teen surfer with 'a big heart' praised for brave double rescue

image.altText: The bomb blast scene in Kuta several days after the bomb blasts.

props.synopsis: Australia asks Malaysia for assurances that two men who admitted conspiring in the Bali bombings are being closely monitored following their repatriation from Guantanamo Bay.

title.children: 'Terrorists shouldn't get deals': Bali bomb duo's transfer sparks anger

image.altText: A man loads a white bag into the trunk of a red sedan car in northern spain

props.synopsis: Spanish police say a Google Street View image allegedly showing a man loading a bag into a car has helped them make two arrests in a murder case.

title.children: Google Maps helps catch alleged killers as it snaps man loading car with suspected body
